required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DEvice-Detected CArdiac Tachyarrhythmic Events and Sleep-disordered Breathing (DEDiCATES)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Multicenter Observation Study on the Association Between the Severity of Device-detected Sleep-disordered Breathing and the Risk of Cardiac Arrhythmic Events

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective multicenter registry study aims to determine whether device-detected sleep-disordered breathing events are associated increased risk of cardiac arrhythmias or other cardiovascular outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: The prevalence of SDB high in patients with cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED). Recently, device-detected SDB events showed a correlation with sleep-disordered breathing (SDB) diagnosed by polysomnography. Thus, CIED will facilitate early detection and monitoring of SDB in patients with CIEDs. Few studies investigated prognostic value of CIED-detected SDB in risk of cardiovascular events. Therefore, the primary aim is to determine whether device-detected SDB are associated with increased risk of cardiac arrhythmias or other cardiovascular morbidities using a prospective multicenter registry.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with atrial fibrillation
primary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to last follow-up (2 years)
primary_outcome.description: cardiac implantable electronic device-detected or clinical atrial fibrillation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with complications associated with atrial fibrillation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to last follow-up (2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: thromboembolic events, heart failure, ablation therapy for atrial fibrillation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with ventricular arrhythmia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to last follow-up (2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: cardiac implantable electronic device-detected or clinical ventricular arrhythmia

other_outcome.measure: Number of participants with major adverse composite events
other_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to last follow-up (2 years)
other_outcome.description: cardiac death, stroke, atrial fibrillation or flutter, ventricular tachyarrhythmia, hospitalization for heart failure

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with low burden of sleep-disordered breathing
Patients with high burden of sleep-disordered breathing

intervention.description: All devices are interrogated at every follow-up, and two questionnaires are performed 2 years after enrollment.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with high burden of sleep-disordered breathing
Patients with low burden of sleep-disordered breathing

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent implantation of cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED) with AP scan function (Boston Scientific.Inc) are eligible for the study during the first 3±1 months after CIED implantation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age ≥ 19years
- CHA2DS2VASc score ≥ 1 in male or ≥ 2 in female
Exclusion Criteria:
- CIED without atrial lead
- persistent or permanent atrial fibrillation (AF) or flutter
- history of catheter of surgical ablation of AF
- valvular steno-insufficiency more than moderate degree
- chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
- under current treatment for sleep-disordered breathing
- life expectancy < 1year

facility.name: The Catholic University of Korea, Seoul St. Mary's Hospital
Yonsei University Health System, Severance Hospital
